input_text:
Job Title: Senior Designer, Electrical

Location: Syracuse, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Your vision is ambitious. Just like ours. 

Our people are our success. As one of us, you will contribute to engineering excellence for the high-tech markets of the future, including semiconductors, batteries, pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, and data centers. At Exyte, you will be part of a global community of challenge seekers who are ambitious and passionate about innovation. Together, we will build on our company’s long history and keep on leading the way to a better world.

Discover your exciting role

Non-Solicitation: We are not currently accepting third-party agency candidates for this position. Any agency candidate submitted to any employee of Exyte may be contacted by Exyte without obligation to the third-party agency.

Job Summary The Senior Designer, Electrical participates in a team environment consisting of engineers and designers to produce construction documents for the following systems: power, lighting, controls, grounding, and the like.

Explore Your Tasks And Responsibilities

Assists in developing electrical documents using architectural background layouts and system performance requirements defined by the project team including the architect, engineer and project manager Assists in pre-design project activities, such as site assessment, site plan review, and verification of as built conditions Assists project team to find optimum system sizing, routing, materials, and space management for equipment and electrical distribution systems Assists senior staff with services during construction, including responding to RFIs, shop drawing and submittal review, and as-built drawings Coordinates with the designs of other trades (architectural and engineering/ internal and external) Assists in developing projects in compliance with engineering codes, standards, principles, relevant specifications and contractual requirements Assists in the production of construction documents under the supervision of a Professional Engineer and coordinate with other disciplines Participates in interdisciplinary review of project deliverables Mentor interns and junior members of project teams Assists in development of construction drawings, specifications, details, schedules and diagrams for electrical and lighting systems Assists in performing quality control reviews of work developed by others Assists in performing calculations: power (load, fault, voltage drop, etc.), lighting, feeder sizing, electrical equipment sizing and the like Assists in performing technical tasks using applicable standards, procedures and codesAssist in providing technical expertise for studies and design effortsOther duties as assigned 

The information contained in this job description is intended to describe the essential job functions required of those assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to perform the job. Please note that management retains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The ability to competently perform all the essential duties of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, demonstrated commitment to effective customer service delivery, integrity, and the ability to work productively as a member of a team or work group are basic requirements of all positions at Exyte Group.

Show Your Expertise

6+ years of experience High School Diploma or GED required Associate’s degree with technical focus preferred Proficient in the use Autodesk Building Systems Software Individual must possess strong communication and organizational skills Strong team player with an ability to build effective working relationships Energetic and self-motivated Working knowledge of Microsoft products

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
